title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
text:
About
I am a digital workplace strategist and knowledge management consultant with over 15 years of international experience across North America, Europe, Middle East and Asia. My work focuses on helping organizations enhance collaboration, adopt AI tools, and align knowledge practices with strategic goals.
I am currently pursuing my MBA at University Canada West and I combine academic research with hands-on experience leading digital transformation initiatives for my clients.

title: Portfolio
text:
Education
Master of Business Administration (MBA)
University Canada West, Vancouver - Expected 2026
Ph.D. in Economics
University of Vitez, Bosnia and Herzegovina - 2018
Diplom-Kauffrau (Equivalent to MBA)
University of Saarland, Germany - 2010

title: Portfolio
text:
Professional Highlights

Research Assistant
University Canada West, Vancouver - 2025 to Present
Contributed to academic projects, co-author publications, and analyzed qualitative data using NVivo.


Manager, Knowledge Management
KPMG US (IT Department), Mexico City - 2020 to 2024
Led digital transformation for a 2,500-employee IT division. Championed AI adoption, redesigned governance frameworks, and optimized collaboration platforms serving 9,000+ users.


Knowledge and Productivity Consultant
Self-Employed, Vancouver - 2020 to Present
Provided consulting and training on knowledge management, AI tools, and productivity strategies for global clients.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
The revised MBA Student Portfolio
The revised MBA Student Portfolio comes with a more refined and publication-ready version of the earlier LLM draft. The revised version is better formatted, with all information organized into a single, easily readable online layout. The geographic regions listed in the revised version have been updated from “North America, Europe, and Asia” to “North America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia.” The proposed completion date of the MBA degree program has been revised from 2025 to 2026. The “About” section of the revised version is rewritten for better readability, stressing the combination of research work as an academic pursuit and experience in the field of consulting. I removed graphics, outline information, and explanatory text in order to have a more professional, publication-ready document. The revised version appears more natural in its text flow, more harmonious with online publishing guidelines, as well as more personal than the earlier LLM outline-format draft.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
1. Site Structure (Pages)

Home / About
Resume / CV
Projects & Case Studies
Skills & Certifications
Contact
Optional: Research & Publications
Optional: Leadership, Mentoring & Community

You can start with the first 5 and add 6–7 later.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
2. Home / About
Purpose: Quick “snapshot” of who you are, what you do, and what you’re looking for next.
Sections:

Hero Section

Name and titles: “Alina Pukhovskaya, MBA, PhD” “Digital Workplace & AI Adoption Strategist”
One-sentence positioning: “I help global organizations improve collaboration, knowledge flows, and AI adoption across teams.”
Call-to-action buttons:

“View Resume” (links to CV page)
“Explore Projects” (links to Projects page)


Current Focus

2–3 short paragraphs:

MBA candidate at University Canada West, focusing on digital transformation and AI in education.
Research Assistant working on AI in education and student experience.
Consulting and training on knowledge management, AI tools, and productivity strategies.


Professional Snapshot

3–4 highlighted stats:

“15+ years of international experience across North America, Europe, Asia.”
“Led knowledge management operations for 2,500+ IT staff in KPMG US.”
“Optimized collaboration tools for 9,000+ users, reducing inactive accounts by 5,000.”
“Mentored 30+ professionals in productivity and knowledge workflows with measurable improvements.”


International Journey

Short narrative about living and working in Germany, Hong Kong/China, Mexico, and Canada.
Emphasis on cross-cultural communication and multilingual work (English, Russian, Spanish, German).

What I’m Looking For

A brief section describing target roles:

Digital workplace / collaboration strategist
Knowledge management / AI adoption roles
Research and education-focused roles linked to AI and learning

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
3. Resume / CV Page
Purpose: Rich, readable resume plus a downloadable PDF.
Sections:

Downloadable CV

Button: “Download Full CV (PDF)”
Short note: “Latest updated: [Month Year].”

Professional Summary

4–5 lines summarizing:

Digital workplace transformation
Knowledge management
AI adoption
Cross-functional leadership and research experience


Experience Timeline Present in reverse chronological order, each with role, organization, location, dates, and key bullets (2–4 per role):

Research Assistant – University Canada West, Vancouver, Canada (2025 – Present)

Research on AI in education and student perception of AI feedback.
NVivo coding and thematic analysis.
Co-authoring and submitting articles to academic journals.

Knowledge & Productivity Consultant – Self-Employed, Vancouver, Canada (2020 – Present)

Consulting and training on knowledge management, AI tools, and productivity for corporate and individual clients.
Mentoring 30+ professionals in APAC, with measurable improvements in productivity and knowledge workflows.
Multilingual workshops and coaching.

Manager, Knowledge Management – KPMG US, Mexico City, Mexico (2020 – 2024)

Leading KM operations for IT department of 2,500 employees.
Driving adoption of AI and GenAI tools through training, newsletters, webinars, and hackathons.
Optimizing collaboration platforms for 9,000+ users and delivering cost savings.

Partner & Principal Consultant – Terra Colligo Latam, Mexico City, Mexico (2017 – 2019)

ERP/CRM implementation and process redesign for SMEs.
Leading digital transformation and change management initiatives.

Operations & Business Development Manager – The World Trader, Mexico City, Mexico (2012 – 2014)

Building operational processes and online channels.
Implementing green marketing strategies.

Risk Executive – EOS Hong Kong Limited, Hong Kong (2010 – 2012)

Designing risk assessment processes and conducting client due diligence.
Representing the company at international trade shows.


Education

MBA – University Canada West, Vancouver, Canada (Expected 2025)
PhD in Economics – University of Vitez, Bosnia and Herzegovina (2018)
Diplom-Kauffrau (equivalent to MBA) – University of Saarland, Germany (2010)

Certifications

KCS Foundation, KCS Academy (2021)
Space for future certifications (e.g., AI / Microsoft / project management).

Languages

English (Fluent), Russian (Fluent), Spanish (Fluent), German (Fluent).

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
4. Projects & Case Studies
Purpose: Show how you think and what you actually did, with outcomes.
Structure: Each case study with the same template:

Context
Challenge
Actions
Results / Impact
Tools & Methods

Suggested case studies from your background:

Case Study 1 – Digital Workplace Optimization for IT Department

Context: KPMG US IT department, 2,500 employees, 9,000+ users of collaboration platforms.
Challenge: Fragmented tools, inactive accounts, unclear governance.
Actions: Redesigned governance framework; cleaned up accounts; drove adoption of collaboration tools.
Results: Reduced inactive accounts by ~5,000 and generated significant annual savings.
Tools: MS Teams, SharePoint, Confluence, ServiceNow.
Theme: Knowledge management, digital workplace transformation, cost optimization.

Case Study 2 – AI & GenAI Adoption Program

Context: Same KPMG environment.
Challenge: Make AI tools understandable and useful for non-technical staff.
Actions: Designed newsletters, internal webinars, training materials, and a hackathon focused on AI use cases.
Results: Increased awareness and use of AI tools, new ideas for process automation.
Theme: AI adoption strategy, change management.

Case Study 3 – Productivity Mentoring Program (Forte Labs Course)

Context: 30+ professionals across APAC participating in a productivity course.
Challenge: Help busy professionals improve time management and knowledge workflows.
Actions: 1:1 mentoring, practical workflows, digital organization systems.
Results: 85% reported measurable improvements in productivity and knowledge workflows.
Theme: Coaching, productivity systems, behavior change.

Case Study 4 – ERP Implementation for SMEs

Context: Terra Colligo Latam consulting engagements.
Challenge: SMEs lacking integrated systems for finance, inventory, and operations.
Actions: Process mapping, requirement gathering, Odoo ERP configuration, training.
Results: Improved reporting, reduced manual work, better visibility into operations.
Theme: Digital transformation, business process redesign.

Case Study 5 – AI in Education Research Project

Context: Research at University Canada West on AI-generated feedback and student perceptions.
Challenge: Understand how students perceive AI-graded feedback and fairness.
Actions: Co-designing study, NVivo coding of interviews, drafting and submitting academic paper.
Results: Manuscript submitted to a peer-reviewed journal; findings on student trust and fairness perceptions.
Theme: Research design, qualitative methods, AI in education.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
5. Skills & Certifications Page
Purpose: Make your capabilities scannable for recruiters and hiring managers.
Sections:

Core Competencies Grouped clusters, each with short descriptive text:

Digital Workplace Transformation
Knowledge Management & Content Governance
AI Adoption & Digital Transformation
Project Management & Process Improvement
Research & Data Analysis (including qualitative NVivo work)
Cross-Functional Leadership & Mentoring
Multilingual Communication & Cross-cultural Collaboration

Technical & Tools

Collaboration & KM: MS Teams, SharePoint, Confluence, ServiceNow.
Analytics & Research: Power BI, NVivo.
ERP/CRM: Odoo and related tools.
Productivity & Knowledge Systems: Any tools you regularly use (Notion, Obsidian, etc., if you want to list).

Certifications

KCS Foundation (with a short line explaining it: knowledge-centered service methodology).
Space for upcoming certifications (e.g., AI or cloud-related).

Soft Skills

Strategic thinking and decision-making.
Conceptual and analytical thinking.
Continuous learning and coaching.
Planning, organizing, and stakeholder communication.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
6. Contact Page
Purpose: Make it easy to reach you.
Sections:

Short Intro

2–3 sentences inviting contact for:

Digital workplace / AI adoption roles.
Research collaborations.
Guest lectures, workshops, or mentoring.


Contact Details

Email (clickable link).
LinkedIn profile (button or icon).
Location: North Vancouver, BC, Canada.

Contact Form

Fields: Name, Email, Organization, Message, “How can I help?”
Optional: dropdown with “Collaboration / Job Opportunity / Speaking / Other”.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
7. Optional Page 1: Research & Publications
Purpose: Showcase academic and research credibility.
Sections:

Current Research Focus

AI in education
Student perceptions of AI-generated grading and feedback
Knowledge management and digital transformation

Publications & Submissions

List co-authored/solo papers:

Submitted article (journal name if allowed, otherwise “submitted to a peer-reviewed journal”).

Your PhD dissertation (title, short abstract).
Any conference proposals or talks.

Methods & Tools

Qualitative research (NVivo coding, thematic analysis).
Mixed-methods or survey design (if applicable).

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
8. Optional Page 2: Leadership, Mentoring & Community
Purpose: Highlight leadership capabilities beyond job titles.
Sections:

People Leadership

Managing and mentoring a team of five at KPMG.
Rotation program for cross-functional knowledge exchange.

Mentoring & Teaching

Mentoring 30+ professionals as part of productivity courses.
Informal teaching/coaching on AI tools and digital workflows.

Community & Speaking

Any talks, webinars, or events you have done or plan to do.
International networking and involvement in professional communities.



If you want, next step I can:

Turn this outline into a Quarto site structure (with index.qmd, projects.qmd, etc.), or
Help you draft the actual text for one page (for example, the Home/About page) in your usual voice.

title: MBA Student Portfolio
text:
LLM Output
Here’s a full outline for your MBA portfolio site, tailored to your real profile and CV.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
text:
Current Focus
I am completing my MBA at University Canada West, where I focus on digital transformation, AI in education, and how technology changes the way people learn and work. Alongside my studies, I work as a Research Assistant examining how students perceive AI-generated feedback, fairness, and trust in academic environments.
I also advise professionals and teams on how to work more effectively with information. My recent work includes training on knowledge management, optimizing digital collaboration tools, and helping people integrate AI into their daily workflows. Across all projects, I focus on clarity, structure, and practical improvements that reduce cognitive load.
Before moving into research and consulting, I spent several years in knowledge management within large technology and consulting environments. This experience shapes my interest in helping organizations adopt digital tools in a grounded and human-centered way.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
text:
Professional Snapshot
Over 15 years of international experience across North America, Europe, Asia, and Latin America.
Managed knowledge operations for an IT organization of 2,500 employees within a global consulting firm.
Optimized collaboration tools for more than 9,000 users, reducing inactive accounts by roughly 5,000 and improving governance.
Mentored over 30 professionals on productivity, information organization, and knowledge workflows, with measurable improvements.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
text:
International Journey
My professional path spans Germany, Hong Kong, Mexico, and Canada. Working across different cultures and systems shaped my approach to collaboration, communication, and problem-solving. I am fluent in English, Russian, Spanish, and German, and have worked in multilingual environments throughout my career.
Each move required adjusting to new contexts, industries, and ways of working, which strengthened my adaptability and understanding of global teamwork. These experiences continue to inform how I support teams navigating change, digital tools, and new ways of working.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
text:
What I Am Looking For
I am open to opportunities where I can contribute to how organizations learn, collaborate, and integrate AI tools in meaningful ways. I am particularly interested in roles related to:

Digital workplace and collaboration strategy
Knowledge management and organizational learning
AI adoption in corporate or educational settings
Research roles focused on technology, learning, and human performance

My goal is to bring structure, clarity, and a research-informed perspective to environments undergoing digital transition.

Technical & Tools

Collaboration & KM: MS Teams, SharePoint, Confluence, ServiceNow.
Analytics & Research: Power BI, NVivo.
ERP/CRM: Odoo and related tools.
Productivity & Knowledge Systems: Any tools you regularly use (Notion, Obsidian, etc., if you want to list).



Soft Skills

Strategic thinking and decision-making.
Conceptual and analytical thinking.
Continuous learning and coaching.
Planning, organizing, and stakeholder communication.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
section: Case Study 1 – Digital Workplace Optimization for IT Department
text:
Case Study 1 – Digital Workplace Optimization for IT Department
Context:
KPMG US IT department with 2,500 employees and more than 9,000 users of collaboration platforms.
Challenge:
Fragmented tools, inactive accounts, and unclear governance practices.
Actions:
Redesigned the governance framework, cleaned up inactive accounts, and supported adoption of key collaboration tools.
Results:
Reduced approximately 5,000 inactive accounts and contributed to significant annual cost savings.
Tools:
MS Teams, SharePoint, Confluence, ServiceNow.
Theme:
Knowledge management, digital workplace transformation, cost optimization.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
section: Case Study 2 – AI & GenAI Adoption Program
text:
Case Study 2 – AI & GenAI Adoption Program
Context:
KPMG US IT environment.
Challenge:
Make AI and GenAI tools understandable and usable for non-technical staff.
Actions:
Designed newsletters, internal webinars, training materials, and a hackathon focused on practical AI use cases.
Results:
Increased awareness and adoption of AI tools and generated new ideas for process automation.
Theme:
AI adoption strategy, change management.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
section: Case Study 3 – Productivity Mentoring Program (Forte Labs Course)
text:
Case Study 3 – Productivity Mentoring Program (Forte Labs Course)
Context:
Over 30 professionals across APAC participating in a structured productivity program.
Challenge:
Help busy professionals improve time management and knowledge workflows.
Actions:
Provided 1:1 mentoring, developed practical workflows, and introduced digital organization systems.
Results:
Eighty-five percent of participants reported measurable improvements in productivity and knowledge workflows.
Theme:
Coaching, productivity systems, behavior change.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
section: Case Study 4 – ERP Implementation for SMEs
text:
Case Study 4 – ERP Implementation for SMEs
Context:
Consulting engagements at Terra Colligo Latam involving small and medium-sized businesses.
Challenge:
SMEs lacked integrated systems for finance, inventory, and operations.
Actions:
Conducted process mapping and requirement gathering, configured Odoo ERP modules, and facilitated staff training.
Results:
Improved operational reporting, reduced manual work, and increased visibility across core business functions.
Theme:
Digital transformation, business process redesign.

title: Dr. Alina Pukhovskaya
section: Case Study 5 – AI in Education Research Project
text:
Case Study 5 – AI in Education Research Project
Context:
Research at University Canada West on student perceptions of AI-generated academic feedback.
Challenge:
Understand how students interpret AI-graded feedback and whether they view it as fair and trustworthy.
Actions:
Co-designed the research, performed NVivo coding on interview data, and drafted and submitted an academic manuscript.
Results:
Manuscript submitted to a peer-reviewed journal; emerging insights highlight how students evaluate trust and fairness in AI-driven assessment.
Theme:
Research design, qualitative methods, AI in education.
